title: Strengthening Business Practical Skills: Integrated Invention Learning and Mastery Learning Based on Medical Simulations

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical procedures and experience with simulation tools
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Within two weeks, learners can design and execute a new medical simulation procedure with 80% accuracy using the PS-I (Problem-Solving Invention) learning method.
According to mastery learning (ML) standards, learners can perform standardized medical procedures (e.g., simulated lumbar puncture) with over 90% proficiency.
At the evaluation stage, learners can demonstrate a Preparedness for Future Learning (PFL) score of over 70% for new medical simulation tasks (e.g., simulated knee joint puncture).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
